main event: A group of observers, including a chemist, sighted a saucer-shaped object in the sky near San Antonio, Texas in 1952.
interesting points: The object was motionless and then disappeared.
The observers described the object as beyond doubt saucer-shaped.
Another sighting reported a silvery, disc-shaped object approximately 40 feet in diameter that displayed no propulsion system and made a rapid ascent before disappearing.
A separate report described an explosion-like flash in the sky that remained visible for about 3 seconds.
Another report described an elongated, lighted object that glided across the sky at a tremendous speed before abruptly disappearing without a sound.
sighted object: saucer-shaped, silvery disc-shaped, and elongated lighted object
witnesses: chemist, law enforcement officers, and other civilian observers
photographs: no, the reports do not contain any photographs
